abstract: Trash-weary officials at the Metropolitan Transportation Authority in New York City are trying a counterintuitive plan at a pair of subway stops by making them entirely bin free; plan would reduce load on city's overtaxed garbage crew and test whether New Yorkers might stop discarding trash if there was nowhere to put it.
snippet: The M.T.A. is trying to reduce the number of garbage bags it has to haul away every day.
lead_paragraph: The M.T.A. is trying to reduce the number of garbage bags it has to haul away every day.

headline.main: A Counterintuitive Trash Plan: Remove Bins in Subway Stations
headline.print_headline: Hoping to Reduce Subway Trash By, of All Things, Removing Bins
headline.seo: M.T.A. Tries to Reduce Total Trash Hauled Away by Train
